VVLI, VVLI General
78.1 VVLI General
� General Information
The aggregate "Variable Valve Lift" coordinates the switching between different lifts of the inlet/outlet valves.
The moment of switching the Valve Lift at normal case depends on the torque request.
If a switching to the other valve lift is required, all informations for a correct control of the actuator will be
calculated and sent to the Basic Software. In parallel the functions which are relevant for the combustion
process will be informed. They have to consider the new charge volume of the engine at their calculations.
The con?rmation if the switching was successful will be done by a diagnosis. In case of an failure (non switching
or electrical) speci?c limp home actions will be done.

78.1.1 Switch VVL setpoint
This module evaluates the torque request of the driver. A decision from a torque or air mass setpoint and
engine speed point of view is done by this module. To avoid oscillations between the different valve lifts, some
hysteresis functions can be used.

VVLI, VVLI General
78.1.2 Switch VVL state coordination (Appl. Inc.)
This module enables the valve lift transitions, if the battery voltage is within a speci?ed range.
Based on several external and input variables the speci?c valve lift can be inhibited.
In case of Start stop the system can be switched in a desired valve lift. During this time STST will be inhibited.
78.1.3 Switch VVL state coordination
This module contains the state machine of the VVL management. The decision to start a valve lift transition
and the coordination of the torque reserve and the according ignition angle intervention is done here. A
request for activating the valve lift actuators is done, if the air mass of the upcoming lift is suf?cient to provide
the requested torque.
78.1.4 Switch VVL control request coordination
A required switch of the valve lift due to a setpoint change or in case of a failure will be coordinated here. Based
on the actual condition of the VVL system and the input from the module "Switch VVL state coordination" the
cylinder/ cylinder banks to be switched are de?ned within this module
The direction of VVL switching is also determined here.
78.1.5 Switch VVL Timing
The switching time of the electric VVL system is the time where the VVL actuator is controlled (pin is moved
out; CAM switching movement can start).
The electrical VVL actuator needs some time till the actuator pin moved out completely due to the time for
building up a magnetic ?eld and moving time of the pin.
Based on several conditions this switching time of the VVL actuator is varying. To consider the in?uence
of the temperature of the VVL actuator a model based on oil temperature and coolant temperature is used.
Additionally the in?uence of voltage, engine speed and number of already done VVL switchings (case speci?c)
will be considered.
78.1.6 Switch VVL Actuator Hit Position
A cylinder speci?c variable describes the position of the engine in �CRK where the pin of the VVL actuator
have to be fully out. Only if this condition is full?lled a correct VVL switching can be guaranteed.
Further an offset is calculated here to de?ne a current feed of the actuator beyond the actuator hit position.
78.1.7 Switch VVL Controller
In this module the VVL actuators are controlled over the interface to the Basic Software. To control the actua-
tors following informations are needed:
- Actuator hit position (CRK_VVL_ACR, cylinder individual)
- Offset to actuator hit position to de?ne a current feed beyond the actuator hit position
(CRK_VVL_ACR_OFS)
- Time of VVL switching (T_SWI_VVL_ACR_TMP, cylinder individual)
- Switch direction (LV_VLFT_SWI_DIR) and switch mode, if the complete engine or a speci?c cylinder
bank have to be switched (STATE_VVL_SWI_MOD)
For cylinder individual switchings a cylinder speci?c logical ?eld is used (LF_VVL_CYL_IND_REQ)
At the same action call to the BSW the information which cylinder will switch at ?rst is asked (NR_CYL_FIRST_
VVL_SWI)
The statuses of the VVL actuator control are asked segment synchronously.
In parallel the information of requested cylinder for switching (STATE_VVL_REQ) and which cylinders are actual
switched (STATE_VVL_BUF_TMP) will be calculated there.
For a better overview at the end of this document a scenario of a complete VVL switching is pictured.

VVLI, VVLI General
78.1.8 Switch VVL State Determination
Some functions need the status of the VVL position (STATE_VVL_ACK_***) at several speci?c times (when
switching is started, valve is open with "new" valve lift, requested torque after switching is available,...). The
calculation of this variables will be done within this module.
78.1.9 Switch VVL Output Signal Diagnosis (Appl. Inc.)
- Inhibition conditions and variables to ERRM for the Switch VVL Output Signal Diagnosis are de?ned there.
78.1.10 Switch VVL Output Signal Diagnosis
- Electrical diagnosis of VVL system
78.1.11 Switch VVL Diagnosis (Appl. Inc.)
- Inhibition conditions and variables to ERRM for the Switch VVL Diagnosis are de?ned
78.1.12 Switch VVL Diagnosis
After the control of the VVL actuator the switching to the other valve lift will be con?rmed within this module.
At the electric version this will be done following:
- During the control the pin of the actuator is moving out and into the slot of an axial moveable part of the
camshaft.
- Due to the rotation of the camshaft and the design of the slot of the camshaft the cam will be changed
(similar to the behaviour of an screw)
- After the motion of the moveable part of the camshaft the pin of the VVL actuator is hit back due to the
design of the slot.
- At the hit back of the pin a voltage is induced; the diagnosis analyse this voltage peak. If the feedback
signal is available over a certain time and a voltage the VVL system has switched the valve lift.
78.1.13 Switch VVL Limp Home Manager
The Limp Home Manager process the inputs from the diagnosis. Based on this results a engine speed limita-
tion, increase of idle speed and certain switchings can be requested.
78.1.14 CAM range variables
The valve overlap changes if the inlet valve lifting curve is switched. Overlaps that can be reached by switching
are calculated here.
78.1.15 VVLI Con?guration Data
Global and local con?guration data are de?ned here.
78.1.16 Scenario of VVL switching (example: V6 engine)

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift timing
The electromechanic switch VVL system operates with a bistable solenoid actuator. The switching time of
the actuator includes a delay time (dead time of the actuator) and the moving time. The switching between
the valve lifting curves occurs when the actuator bolt is fully out at a certain position of the switching slot
of the VVL system. It is necessary to know the switching time of the actuator in order to reach a successful
switching.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: SEG

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift timing
The switching time includes the maximum moving time of the VVL actuator (limited by the geometry of the
mechanical VVL system). Because the bolt will not move before the end of the dead time of the actuator, the
control of the VVL actuator can be started earlier.
Maximum time range where the VVL actuator can actually move out:

78.4.1 Initialization
78.4.1.1 Initialization at reset
All variables initialized with 0
78.4.2 Segment task
78.4.2.1 For Loop (NC_CYL_NR)
78.4.2.1.1 Calculation of the hit position and the offset
The hit position is calculated from a calibration constant (for each cylinder) and the actual cam phasing. For
inlet VVL systems the inlet cam phasing will be considered (subtracted). In case of an exhaust VVL system the
exhaust cam phasing will be considered (added). Additionally a correction can be applied (IP_CRK_N_SHIFT_
VVL_ACR).
An offset can be used (depending on STATE_VVL_CTL) to control the actuator additionally beyond the hit
position.

78.5.3.1 VVL state manager
The VVL state machine de?nes the VVL states. The outputs STATE_VLFT_MNG and LV_VVL_TRAN_ACT are
generated. The function calls, which activate the according transition condition calculation, are de?ned in the
state machine as well.
TRAN_VVL_CTL indicates the next state, which is choosen for transition.

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift state coordination
78.5.3.2.1 Transition condition in the state VLFT_STND
In the state VLFT_STND all valves run with the STND lift. The request to switch to the LFT_1 lift can be done by
the requested torque or by an external switch. A transition can be disabled by requests of the module Switch
VVL state coordination (Appl. inc.) and by an active clutch switch for a certain time. The transition to the LFT_1
lift can be inhibited, when the TCO and TOIL is very low. Inhibiting the STND lift with LV_INH_VLFT_STND enable
limp home reaction and force transition to the LFT_1 lift. There is the possibility (LC_TRAN_VLFT_1_PU_INH) to
inhibit the transition to low lift if STATE_ENG = PU.

78.5.3.2.2 Transition condition in the state PREP_VLFT_1
A transition to the state TRAN_VLFT_1 is done, when the basic torque in the LFT_1 lift will be as high as the
current torque in the STND lift. A transition to the state TRAN_VLFT_STND can be forced by the torque request
LV_TQI_VLFT_STND_REQ. After a calibratable time the transition to the stationary state VLFT_STND is forced.

A transition to the state TRAN_VLFT_STND can be forced by the torque request
LV_TQI_VLFT_STND_REQ. After a calibratable time the transition to the stationary state VLFT_STND is forced.
The transition back to the high lift is only allowed if the high lift isn?t inhibited LV_INH_VLFT_STND.

Figure 78.5.12:
78.5.3.2.3.2 Transition condition in the state TRAN_VLFT_1
The valves start to switch to VLFT_1, when the state TRAN_VLFT_1 is entered. When all valves run with the
LFT_1 lift and the difference between the MAF with the LFT_1 lift and MAF setpoint is low enough, a transition
to the state VLFT_1 is performed. An additonal torque request can be applied until all valves run at the LFT_1
lift. After a calibratable time the transition to the stationary state VLFT_1 is forced. The transition back to the
STND lift is only allowed if the STND lift isn?t inhibited by LV_INH_VLFT_STND.

Figure 78.5.13:
78.5.3.2.4 Transition condition in the state VLFT_1
In the state VLFT_1 all valves run with LFT_1 lift. A transition to the STND lift is done, if a high torque is requested,
the LFT_1 lift is disabled or the external request switch is enabled and active. The transition to VLFT_STND can
be inhibited when TCO and TOIL is very low. Transition to VLFT_STND is allowed when VLFT_STND is not
inhibited (LV_INH_VLFT_STND).

Figure 78.5.14:
78.5.3.2.5 Transition condition in the state PREP_VLFT_STND
There is a check whether the torque with the STND lift will be greater than the current torque of the engine,
before the transition to the STND lift is enabled. An additional torque reserve will be applied during this state, if
the torque with the STND lift would not be suf?cient.

transition to the state VLFT_STND is performed. An additonal torque request can be applied until all valves
run at the STND lift. After a calibratable time the transition to the stationary state VLFT_STND is forced. The
transition back to VLFT_1 is only allowed if VLFT_1 isn?t inhibited by LV_INH_VLFT_1.

78.6.1 Initialisation
78.6.1.1 Initialisation at reset and engine run to engine stop
All variables besides LV_VVL_SWI_AUTH are initialized with 0
78.6.2 Operate Segment
78.6.2.1 Inhibition of a calibratable valve lift after engine start
Valve lift switching during engine start must be inhibited. It can also be inhibited after start for a calibratable
number of cycles if the driver does not request a switching via PV_AV.

78.6.2.2 Get permission from FARM
LV_VVL_RGL_OPM is set when no failure (de?ned in FARM) is present.
78.6.2.3 Determination of valve lift switch request for upcoming start stop engine stop
The information from the STST manager for a possibly upcoming driver request for STST stop (STATE_STST_
STOP_DRIV_OUT=2) or an actual driver stop request (STATE_STST_STOP_DRIV_OUT=3) are used to set a switch-
ing request in the applicatable valve lift. If the conditions for an actual driver stop request are ful?lled a timer
will be increased and the information if the valve lift system is in the desired vale lift at this moment will be
stored in LV_T_STST_STOP_INH_VVL_ENA. The request will be reset if the conditions are not ful?lled and a STST
cycle is not ongoing jet or the STST cycle is aborted in case of "change of mind".
In case an automatic transmission is mounted, the switch request will be delayed by an applicatable time.

78.6.2.5.1 Calculation of temporary and ?nal stop inhibition
78.6.2.5.1.1 Determination of STST stop inhibition from valve lift system
A start stop STOP will be inhibited:
- if the valve lift system is within passive state (PASSIVE) or a switch correction (SWI_COR) or long control(LNG_
CTL).
- if a regular switching (RGL_SWI) is ongoing and the valve lift system is not jet in the desired lift (If calibrated).
- if the valve lift system is in limp home and LIH switchings are not over jet.

78.6.2.5.1.2 Final inhibition calculation
Depending on LC_T_STST_STOP_INH_VVL_ENA the timer will be used for every STST stop or only if VVL system
is not in the desired valve lift.
The calibration of C_T_MIN_STST_STOP_INH_VVL_SWI should be shorter then the STST-Coordinator timer which
discards a stop cycle in case an external stop inhibition is set.
For automatic transmissions a STST stop will not be delayed by the timer.

78.6.2.7 Calculation of TQ_ADD_VVL
This function allows to request a torque reserve for the VVL switching. This reserve might be necessary due
to a resulting torque drop while switching from VLFT_1 to VLFT_STND. In the state coordination module it is
checked whether the necessary torque was build up before it is allowed to enter the transition phase.
The request will start as soon as the preparation phase is entered. After leaving the preparation state it is
possible to decrease the request over time (maximum is the maximal time in the transition phase). Additionally
it is possible to correct the torque request depending on the MAF value.

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift control request coordination
� Calibration Data
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
C_CTR_VVL_LIH_CTL_ACT V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Number of VVL switchings after then limp home switchings will be activated
C_CTR_VVL_LIH_CTL_DEAC V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Number of VVL switchings after then limp home switchings will be deactivated
C_NR_SEG_CTR_VVL_ACT V 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
Number of segments at engine start when VVL control is enabled
C_TOIL_THD_VVL_HOT V 0... C8H -40 ...160 1 �C
Temperature threshold above VVL is running at hot temperatures
C_TOIL_THD_VVL_LIH_DEAC V 0... C8H -40 ...160 1 �C
Temperature threshold to leave LIH_1 after a switching at cold start
LC_CTR_VVL_LIH_SWI_CLR V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Logical switch to clear limp home counter
� General Information
The Switch VVL Control Request Coordination manages new requests due to torque and extraordinary from
the limp home management.
Task of the calculations within this module is to support the Switch VVL controller following important data for
a new switching of the valve lift:
- LV_VVL_CTL_TRIG: Trigger of VVL Controller that new switching has to be controlled
- LV_VVL_SWI_CYL_IND: information if individual cylinder or complete cylinder bank has to be switched
- STATE_VVL_SWI_MOD: cylinder banks to be switched
- LF_VVL_CYL_IND_REQ: cylinders to be controlled
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, ERU2ES, IGKON, NVMINI, NVMRES, NVMSTO
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: SEG

mode can be left only in special cases (see state?ow of STATE_VVL_CTL)
If not all cylinders has switched at the ?rst trial within VVL Limp Home further trials will be done for the non-
switched cylinders (similar to LNG_CTL).

Figure 78.7.36:
78.7.2.4.1.1.1.1 Inhibition of simultanous long control
Due to HW constraints two actuators have to use one common diagnosis channel. During individual switch-
ing operation (long control) this can lead to overlapping of switching pulse and feedback pulse of two actuators
and this can lead to wrong switching diagnosis results. To avoid this, there is a routine to postpone long control
on one cylinder (e.g. cyl 2) if the corresponding cylinder (e.g. cyl 0) is already in long control.

C_N_MIN_VVL_CTL V 0... 1FE0H 0... 8160 1 rpm
Minimum engine speed to activate VVL controller
C_NR_SEG_ACR_SWI_END_THD V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -

C_NR_SEG_POST_TRIG V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift controller
78.8.2.1.1 Update of variables to de?ne VVL switchings
The variables CTR_VVL_SWI_L and CTR_VVL_SWI_H will be saved at the ?x area of the Software. Thus the value
will not be deleted in case of ?ashing a new Software.
If a SCP or OC failure disappears during a control then the counters for the cylinder individual control will
be reset. (Otherwise the VVL controller goes to limp home, but no failure will be debounced. (see For loop
below)
If a SCG failure occurs, but not yet debounced, no switching will be allowed.
Additionally, a switching to VLFT_1 is inhibited above a certain engine speed threshold.

switching time is calculated and the corresponding action to the BSW is called.
Afterwards the switch speci?c counters and the determination of switched cylinders is updated.

78.11.1 Initialisation

78.11.2 Operate segment
78.11.2.1 Setpoint calculation - overview
The main request for VVL switch is indicated by LV_TQI_VLFT_STND_REQ, which is "1" for request for Standard
valve lift and "0" for low valve lift (Avs Lift).
78.11.2.1.1 Setpoint target
Here the setpoint for valve lift switch is calculated with N- and MAF -hysteresis. Calibration of IP_VLFT_SP with
1 requests low lift (LFT_1), 0 requests standard lift (LFT_STND). To switch in LFT_STND the Map with regulare N-
MAF- inputs is considered. To switch back in LFT_1 the same map is considered but here the inputs are added
by an calibratable hysteresis. Therefore switching back in LFT_1 is delayed by the hyteresis. Without delay
(*_WOUT_DLY) means, the request follows direct engine speed and driver request.

78.11.2.1.2 Delay of VVL switching request
The switching request coming from IP_VLFT_SP can be delayed in a certain direction depending on LC_VLFT_
STND_REQ_DLY with IP_T_DLY_VLFT_SP to avoid very short switching sequences.
For engines which need to switch to STND lift at high engine speeds or can not be switched at high engine
speeds, IP_T_DLY_VLFT_SP should be calibrated with caution since it must be assured that the system will
switch in STND lift in time if LC_VLFT_STND_REQ_DLY is 1 (the switching from VLFT_1 to STND will be delayed).

� General Information
This diagnosis monitors the output signals of each individual switch VVL actuator.
Description:
It is necessary to have error ?ags for each failure symptom. If there is the SCG failure on an actuator the engine
can be damaged with very high probability if switching with the second actuator of this cylinder is activated.
It is not needed to distinguish between SCP and OC failures because the VVL system reaction is the same, but
due to ATIC 94 behaviour both failures are determined seperately.
The SCG and OC diagnosis is active always. The actuators are switched off most of the time. It is possible to
detect the SCG and OC failure. There are short switch on periods sometimes (valve lifting curve switching).
It is not possible to detect the SCG and OC failure during a switch on period. The anti-bounce counter may
be decremented. It is no problem if suitable anti-bounce parameters are chosen (high increment value at
decrement 1). There is some time to increment the counter after an actuator?s activation (anti-bounce counter
decrementation possible) till the error ?ag has to be set. i.e. till an activation of the other actuator at his cylinder
can be requested.
The SCP diagnosis is possible only during the activation of the actuator.
If one switch VVL error at least is detected and the failure memory is reset afterwards during engine running
the regular diagnostic operation is interrupted for one recurrence. The error management interface is set in
such way that the errors for the actuators detected faulty beforehands are set immediately in this recurrence.
All switch VVL diagnostic information is kept. This has to be enabled by LC_VLFT_DIAG_EL_FMY_CLR.
Due to the fact that system reaction on SCP and OC failures is similar, a summary failure bit is created as
interface to modules that do not distinguish between the two symptoms.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At reset, at IGK off -> on:
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR -1
/*to rebuild MEM_INI behaviour. LV_ERR_REC_VLFT_1/STND_SCG
is used to initialize the ABC in case of an failure at last
DC*/
if ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCG[x]) =
1
then LV_ERR_REC_VLFT_STND_SCG[x] = 1
endif
if ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_1_SCG[x]) = 1
then LV_ERR_REC_VLFT_1_SCG[x] = 1
endif

ACTION_ERRM_Reset (NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_1_SCG[x])
ACTION_ERRM_Reset (NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCP[x])
ACTION_ERRM_Reset (NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_1_SCP[x])
ACTION_ERRM_Reset (NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_STND_OC[x])

/*to restart the diagnosis at once(the action call from the
error management can be delayed)*/
ACTION_VVLI_ResetDiagVlftStndScg(0,x)
ACTION_VVLI_ResetDiagVlft1Scg(0,x)
ACTION_VVLI_ResetDiagVlftStndScp(0,x)

ACTION_VVLI_ResetDiagVlftStndOc(0,x)
ACTION_VVLI_ResetDiagVlft1Oc(0,x)
endfor
Activation: At every engine state
Deactivation: not activation
Recurrence: 10ms

and LC_VLFT_DIAG_EL_FMY_CLR=1
then
ABC_VLFT_1_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=C_ABC_MAX_VLFT_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]
ACTION_ERRM_Record(IN<NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_1_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]>,
IN<STATE_FIL_VLFT_1_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]>)
else /* if a SCG failure is or was present the ABC will be initialized
differently in order to rebuild MEM_INI behaviour*/
if LV_ERR_REC_VLFT_1_SCG[x] = 1
then
STATE_FIL_VLFT_1_SCG[x]=NO_EVE
LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_1_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=0
LV_SYM_VLFT_1_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=0
ABC_VLFT_1_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=C_ABC_MAX_VLFT_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]-
C_ABC_INC_VLFT_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]
else
STATE_FIL_VLFT_1_SCG[x]=NO_EVE
LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_1_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=0
LV_SYM_VLFT_1_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=0
ABC_VLFT_1_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=0
endif
endif

/* to disable the reset of the diagnosis if the engine is running
with present failure*/

and LV_ES=0

then
ABC_VLFT_STND_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=C_ABC_MAX_VLFT_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]

IN<STATE_FIL_VLFT_STND_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]>)
else /* if a SCG failure is or was present the ABC will be initialized
differently in order to rebuild MEM_INI behaviour*/
if LV_ERR_REC_VLFT_STND_SCG[x] = 1
then
STATE_FIL_VLFT_STND_SCG[x]=NO_EVE

LV_SYM_VLFT_STND_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=0
ABC_VLFT_STND_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=C_ABC_MAX_VLFT_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]-
C_ABC_INC_VLFT_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]
else
STATE_FIL_VLFT_STND_SCG[x]=NO_EVE
LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_STND_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=0
LV_SYM_VLFT_STND_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=0
ABC_VLFT_STND_SCG[PRM_NR_CONF]=0
endif
endif

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift output signal diagnosis (Appl. Inc.)
78.13.2 Recurrence 10ms
78.13.2.1 Calculation of Recurrence 10ms
For Actuator Test, you switch off the Main-Relay. If you switch off the main relay, the ATIC-device recognize a
certain voltage. Sometimes this voltage is under 2Volt, a SCG-failure is recognized in the ECU:.
Now, for actuator-test, the label VP_PWR[NC_IDX_V_RLY_MAIN] is compared with C_V_RLY_MAIN_INH_VVL_
DIAG. If the voltage is greater than this calibration label, ATIC does not recognize a SCG-failure and the actuator-
test can be done.

ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(IN<NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCG[x]>,
OUT<LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCG[x]>)
if LV_SYM_VLFT_STND_SCP[x] = 1
then
ERR_SYM_VLFT_STND_SCP[x] = SYM_0
else
ERR_SYM_VLFT_STND_SCP[x] = NO_SYM
endif
ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(IN<NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCP[x]>,
OUT<LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCP[x]>)
if LV_SYM_VLFT_1_OC[x] = 1
then
ERR_SYM_VLFT_1_OC[x] = SYM_2
else
ERR_SYM_VLFT_1_OC[x] = NO_SYM
endif
ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(IN<NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_1_OC[x]>,
OUT<LV_ERR_VLFT_1_OC[x]>)
if LV_SYM_VLFT_1_SCG[x] = 1
then
ERR_SYM_VLFT_1_SCG[x] = SYM_1
else
ERR_SYM_VLFT_1_SCG[x] = NO_SYM
endif
ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(IN<NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_1_SCG[x]>,
OUT<LV_ERR_VLFT_1_SCG[x]>)
if LV_SYM_VLFT_1_SCP[x] = 1
then
ERR_SYM_VLFT_1_SCP[x] = SYM_0
else
ERR_SYM_VLFT_1_SCP[x] = NO_SYM
endif
ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(IN<NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_1_SCP[x]>,
OUT<LV_ERR_VLFT_1_SCP[x]>)
endfor
Creating of summary error bit SCP_OC:
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR -1
if LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCP[x] = 1
or LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_OC[x] = 1
then
LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCP_OC[x] = 1
else

if LV_ERR_VLFT_1_SCP[x] = 1
or LV_ERR_VLFT_1_OC[x] = 1

78.15.1 Diagnosis
File: 30A0IG04.00C
26672Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift diagnosis
� General Information
The VVL mechanics has the following property. When the bolt of the solenoid actuator switches between the
valve lifting curves there is a recoil of it by the switching slot. Voltage is induced. It is possible to measure this
voltage signal (relative to battery voltage) by means of a diagnostic hardware.
Description:
In order to recognise the recoil signal it is necessary to connect the corresponding cylinder with the diagnostic
hardware. There is one diagnostic hardware for each cylinder bank (number of cylinder banks is speci?ed by
NC_NR_CBK_MEC). The allocation of the cylinders to the cylinder banks is speci?ed by NLF_IDX_CYL_CBK_MEC.
The diagnostic hardware delivers a logical diagnostic signal that is to evaluate. The logical signal becomes
active if the actuator is connected to the diagnostic hardware and the recoil signal reaches some threshold.
The diagnostic algorithm is realised in the I/O software and the communication is realised by ACTION_INFR_
SwiVvlElSetDiag and ACTION_INFR_SwiVvlElGetDiag.
The crankshaft positions used here have 0 �CRK at the ?rst tooth after the gap (?rst falling edge after the gap)
before TDC0.
There is the same diagnosis for cold and hot conditions with individual error mangement.
It is possible to let the diagnosis active but supress handing on the diagnostic result to the limp home manager
by LC_VVL_DIAG_LIH_ENA.
If there is a suspicion for an SCP_OC failure the diagnosis remains active but the antibouncing is disabled.
This diagnosis is part of the EOL test function. If the EOL test is active special antibounce parameters are used
(C_ABC_INC_VLFT_SWI_EOL).
If one switch VVL error at least is detected and the failure memory is reset afterwards during engine running
the regular diagnostic operation is interrupted for one recurrence. The error management interface is set in
such way that the errors for the actuators detected faulty beforehands are set immediately in this recurrence.
All switch VVL diagnostic information is kept. This has to be enabled by LC_VLFT_DIAG_SWI_FMY_CLR.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: In case of checksum error:
LF_VLFT_1_SWI_NOT = 0
LF_VLFT_STND_SWI_NOT = 0
At Reset and IGK off -> on:
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR-1
for t = 0 to 1
ACTION_ERRM_Reset (NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_1_V[x][t])
ACTION_ERRM_Reset (NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_STND_V[x][t])
endfor
endfor
At ERU2ES:
LF_VVL_DIAG_MNG = 0H
STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT = 0H
LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_NOT = 0H
LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_OK = 0H
LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_NOT_PREV = 0H
LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_OK_PREV = 0H
At ES2ERU:
LF_CRK_VVL_ACR_END_PREV = LF_CRK_VVL_ACR_END
Activation: at every engine state
Deactivation: not activation
Recurrence: Segment synchronous
� Function Description
File: 30A0IG04.00C
26673Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift diagnosis
Temperature evaluation:
IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG = LV_VVL_DIAG_HOT
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_STND_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 0
LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_1_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 0
endfor
ACTION_INFR_SwiVvlElGetDiag(LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_NOT,LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_OK,CALL)
Initialisation after clearing of failure memory
if LV_VLFT_DIAG_SWI_STND_FMY_CLR = 1
and LV_VLFT_DIAG_SWI_1_FMY_CLR = 1
then LV_VLFT_DIAG_SWI_STND_FMY_CLR = 0
LV_VLFT_DIAG_SWI_1_FMY_CLR = 0
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR -1
for t = 0 to 1
if ( ABC_VLFT_STND_SWI[x] [t] >= C_ABC_MAX_VLFT_SWI
or ABC_VLFT_1_SWI[x] [t] >= C_ABC_MAX_VLFT_SWI )
then switching error present
endif
endfor
endfor
if switching error present
and LC_VLFT_DIAG_SWI_FMY_CLR = 1
then /* no change */
else LV_VVL_DIAG_MNG = 0
STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT = 0
endif
Watch switching pulse - recoil pulse will follow soon:
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
if LF_CRK_VVL_ACR_END_PREV[bit x] <>
LF_CRK_VVL_ACR_END[bit x]
then /* Hit position reached */
LF_VVL_DIAG_MNG[bit x] = 1
endif
endfor
LF_CRK_VVL_ACR_END_PREV = LF_CRK_VVL_ACR_END
Error detection:
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
/* Actuators switching to valve lifting curve "STND" (LV_VLFT_SWI_DIR=0)
or test switching to valve lifting curve "LFT_1": */
if ( ( LV_VLFT_SWI_DIR = 0
and LV_VVL_LIH_TEST_CTL_ACT[x] = 0)
or ( LV_VLFT_SWI_DIR = 1
and LV_VVL_LIH_TEST_CTL_ACT[x] = 1))
and ( ( LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_NOT_PREV[bit x] = 0
and LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_NOT[bit x] = 1)
or ( LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_OK_PREV[bit x] = 0
and LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_OK[bit x] = 1))
then /* Diagnostic status of cylinder x available */
if LV_INH_DIAG_VLFT_STND_SWI[x] = 0
and LV_VVL_DIAG_DEAC_LIH = 0
and LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCG[x] = 0
and LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCP[x] = 0
and LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_OC[x] = 0
then
LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_STND_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 1

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift diagnosis
else
LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_STND_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 0
endif
LF_VVL_DIAG_MNG[bit x] = 0
if LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_STND_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 1
then
if LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_OK[bit x](n) = 1
then /* Switching OK */
LV_SYM_VLFT_STND_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 0
STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT[bit x] = 0
else /* Switching not OK */
LV_SYM_VLFT_STND_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 1
STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT[bit x] = LC_VVL_DIAG_LIH_ENA
endif
LF_VLFT_STND_SWI_NOT[bit x] = STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT[bit x]
else
LV_SYM_VLFT_STND_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG](n) =
LV_SYM_VLFT_STND_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG](n-1)
endif
endif
/* Actuators switching to valve lifting curve "LFT_1" (LV_VLFT_SWI_DIR=1)
or test switching to valve lifting curve "STND": */
if ( ( LV_VLFT_SWI_DIR = 1
and LV_VVL_LIH_TEST_CTL_ACT[x] = 0)
or ( LV_VLFT_SWI_DIR = 0
and LV_VVL_LIH_TEST_CTL_ACT[x] = 1))
and ( ( LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_NOT_PREV[bit x] = 0
and LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_NOT[bit x] = 1)
or ( LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_OK_PREV[bit x] = 0
and LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_OK[bit x] = 1))
then /* Diagnostic status of cylinder x available */
if LV_INH_DIAG_VLFT_1_SWI[x] = 0
and LV_VVL_DIAG_DEAC_LIH = 0
and LV_ERR_VLFT_1_SCG[x] = 0
and LV_ERR_VLFT_1_SCP[x] = 0
and LV_ERR_VLFT_1_OC[x] = 0
then
LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_1_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 1
else
LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_1_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 0
endif
LF_VVL_DIAG_MNG[bit x] = 0
if LV_CDN_DIAG_VLFT_1_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 1
then
if LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_OK[bit x](n) = 1
then /* Switching OK */
LV_SYM_VLFT_1_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 0
STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT[bit x] = 0
else /* Switching not OK */
LV_SYM_VLFT_1_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG] = 1
STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT[bit x] = LC_VVL_DIAG_LIH_ENA
endif
LF_VLFT_1_SWI_NOT[bit x] = STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT[bit x]
else
LV_SYM_VLFT_1_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG](n) =
LV_SYM_VLFT_1_V[x][IDX_TEMP_VVL_DIAG](n-1)
endif
endif
endfor
LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_NOT_PREV = LF_VVL_DIAG_SWI_NOT

78.15.2 Diagnosttic parameters
� General Information
The diagnostic signal is evaluated. The parameters for its evaluation are calculated here.
Description:
The diagnostic window parameters are set short before the control event. Then, the diagnostic algorithm is
launched with them. They can change till the last cylinder monitoring is ?nished due to a change of engine
speed, camshaft phase or battery voltage. Therefore, these parameters are updated after the control event for
some segments.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At reset, at transition "engine run" � "engine stop", at failure
memory reset:
CTR_WIN_UPD_VVL_DIAG = C_CTR_WIN_UPD_VVL_DIAG
Activation: At every engine state
Deactivation: Not activation
Recurrence: Segment synchronous
� Function Description
if LV_VVL_CTL_TRIG(n-1) = 1
and LV_VVL_CTL_TRIG(n) = 0
then /* Check end of control event */
CTR_WIN_UPD_VVL_DIAG = 0
else /* Phase after control event */
CTR_WIN_UPD_VVL_DIAG = CTR_WIN_UPD_VVL_DIAG + 1
endif
if LV_VVL_CTL_TRIG = 1
or CTR_WIN_UPD_VVL_DIAG < C_CTR_WIN_UPD_VVL_DIAG
then /* Set or update VVL diagnostic window parameters */
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
IDX_CBK_VVL_DIAG = NLF_IDX_CYL_CBK_MEC[bit x] + 1
# if NC_NR_VVL_IN > 1
# then /* consideration of inlet cam phasing */
CRK_BEG_VVL_DIAG_TMP =
C_CRK_BEG_VVL_DIAG[x] -
CAM_PHA_ENG[NC_IDX_IN][IDX_CBK_VVL_DIAG] +
ID_CRK_BEG_OFS_VVL_DIAG
# else /* consideration of exhaust cam phasing */
CRK_BEG_VVL_DIAG_TMP =
C_CRK_BEG_VVL_DIAG[x] +
CAM_PHA_ENG[NC_IDX_EX][IDX_CBK_VVL_DIAG] +
ID_CRK_BEG_OFS_VVL_DIAG
# endif
CRK_END_VVL_DIAG_TMP =
CRK_BEG_VVL_DIAG_TMP +
C_CRK_DUR_VVL_DIAG +
ID_CRK_END_OFS_VVL_DIAG
if CRK_BEG(_END)_VVL_DIAG_TMP < 0
then
CRK_BEG(_END)_VVL_DIAG_TMP = 720 �CRK +
CRK_BEG(_END)_VVL_DIAG_TMP
else
CRK_BEG(_END)_VVL_DIAG_TMP =
CRK_BEG(_END)_VVL_DIAG_TMP modulo 720 �CRK
endif

� General Information
78.16.1 Inhibition calculation
� General Information
Project speci?c settings of the switch VVL diagnosis are speci?ed here.
Description:
The switch VVL EOL test is realised by the regular diagnosis. If a failure is detected then the diagnosis for
this cylinder is disabled. This inhibition can be kept till a new driving cycle or till a failure memory reset if
LC_VLFT_DIAG_EOL_DI_HLD = 1.
The switch VVL diagnosis distinguishes cold and hot engine operating range:
NC_IDX_DIAG_VLFT(_1)_STND_V[x][0], LV_ERR_VLFT_STND(_1)_V[x][0] - cold
NC_IDX_DIAG_VLFT(_1)_STND_V[x][1], LV_ERR_VLFT_STND(_1)_V[x][1] - hot
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At reset:
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
LV_INH_DIAG_VLFT_STND_SWI[x] = 0
endfor
At reset, at system event ignition on, at failure memory reset:
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
LV_VLFT_DIAG_EOL_DI[x] = 0
endfor
LV_VVL_RBM_DI_EOL = 0
At transition "engine run" ? "engine stop":
CTR_VLFT_STND_DIAG_DEAC_RBM = 0
CTR_VLFT_1_DIAG_DEAC_RBM = 0
Activation: at every engine state
Deactivation: not activation
Recurrence: Segment synchronous
� Function Description
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
if LV_VVL_EOL_SWI_ACT = 1
and LV_VLFT_DIAG_EOL_DI[x] = 0
then /* EOL test active and no failure till now */
LV_VLFT_DIAG_EOL_DI[x] = (LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SWI[x]
or LV_ERR_VLFT_1_SWI[x])
endif
if LV_VVL_EOL_SWI_ACT = 0
then /* EOL test inactive */
if LC_VLFT_DIAG_EOL_DI_HLD = 0
then
LV_VLFT_DIAG_EOL_DI[x] = 0
endif
endif
LV_INH_DIAG_VLFT_STND_SWI[x] = (LV_VLFT_DIAG_EOL_DI[x]
or not(ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_ERR_VLFT_STND_SWI[x])))
LV_INH_DIAG_VLFT_1_SWI[x] = (LV_VLFT_DIAG_EOL_DI[x]
or not(ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_ERR_VLFT_1_SWI[x])))
endfor

78.16.2 RBM interface
� General Information
This RBM interface function was developed with the assumption that the cold range is out of the OBD regula-
tion scope. In case of a change of this situation this function has to be checked.
The driving cycle for the switch VVL diagnosis is speci?ed additionally to the standard cycle by the "two times
activation" condition. The realisation within this function is that each actuator has to be commanded two
times at least in order to release the RBM interface. The number of the switch commands is available in
CTR_VLFT_STND(_1)_SWI[NC_CYL_NR]. There is a special case when the actuators are commanded but no
diagnosis is expected, LV_VVL_DIAG_DEAC_LIH=1. The switch direction is derived from LV_VLFT_SWI_DIR. The
difference CTR_VLFT_STND(_1)_SWI[x]-CTR_VLFT_STND(_1)_DIAG_DEAC_RBM is used for the calculation of the
bit 2 of STATE_RBM_.... LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_V[NC_CYL_NR][2] is usually detected by more than 2 activations.
These actuation commands are not included in CTR_VLFT_STND(_1)_SWI[NC_CYL_NR]. Thus, in case of a failure
the bit 2 is set by the error ?ag. This has to be enabled by LC_ERR_VLFT_V_RBM_BIT_2.
The bit 0 is calculated from LV_END_DIAG_... of the switch VVL diagnosis.
The bit 1 is calculated from the errors that inhibit the switch VVL diagnosis.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At reset:
for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
STATE_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][bit0] = 0
STATE_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][bit1] = 0
STATE_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][bit2] = 0
STATE_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][bit0] = 0
STATE_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][bit1] = 0
STATE_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][bit2] = 0
endfor
Activation: LV_FID_READY = 1
Deactivation: not activation
Recurrence: 1 s

for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
/* Bit 0: */
if STATE_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][bit0] = 0
then
if ACTION_ERRM_GetEndDiag(NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_STND_V[x][1]) = 1
and LV_VVL_RBM_DI_EOL = 0
then
STATE_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][bit0] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][1])
endif
endif
if STATE_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][bit0] = 0
then
if ACTION_ERRM_GetEndDiag(NC_IDX_ERR_VLFT_1_V[x][1]) = 1
and LV_VVL_RBM_DI_EOL = 0
then
STATE_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][bit0] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][1])
endif
endif
/* End of Bit 0 */
/* Bit 1: */
if STATE_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][bit1] = 0
then
if ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x]) = 0
then
STATE_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][bit1] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_LockRbmMonitorFor(NC_IDX_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][1])
endif
endif
if STATE_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][bit1] = 0
then
if ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x]) = 0
then
STATE_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][bit1] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_LockRbmMonitorFor(NC_IDX_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][1])
endif
endif
/* End of Bit 1 */
/* Bit 2: */
if STATE_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][bit2] = 0
then
if CTR_VLFT_STND_SWI[x] - CTR_VLFT_STND_DIAG_DEAC_RBM >= 2
or (STATE_FIL_VLFT_STND_V[x][1] = FAIL
and LC_ERR_VLFT_V_RBM_BIT_2 = 1)
then
STATE_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][bit2] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor(NC_IDX_RBM_VLFT_STND_V[x][1])
endif
endif
if STATE_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][bit2] = 0
then
if CTR_VLFT_1_SWI[x] - CTR_VLFT_1_DIAG_DEAC_RBM >= 2
or (STATE_FIL_VLFT_1_V[x][1] = FAIL
and LC_ERR_VLFT_V_RBM_BIT_2 = 1)
then
STATE_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][bit2] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor(NC_IDX_RBM_VLFT_1_V[x][1])
endif
endif
/* End of Bit 2 */
endfor

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift limp home manager
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
1 = Activate limp home switching due to VVL defective failure acc. to STATE_VVL_LIH_DFCT; 0 = Deactive
LC_VVL_LIH_SWI_ACT_OC [4] V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
1 = Activate limp home switching due to VVL OC failure acc. to STATE_VVL_LIH_OC; 0 = Deactive
LC_VVL_LIH_SWI_ACT_SCG [4] V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
1 = Activate limp home switching due to VVL SCG failure acc. to STATE_VVL_LIH_SCG; 0 = Deactive
LC_VVL_LIH_SWI_ACT_SWI_COR [7] V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
1 = Activate limp home switching due to VVL switch correction acc. to STATE_VVL_LIH_SWI_COR; 0 = Deactive
LC_VVL_LIH_SWI_IMDT_DFCT [4] V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Immediate VVL switching request according to STATE_VVL_LIH_DFCT
LC_VVL_LIH_SWI_IMDT_SCG [4] V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Immediate VVL switching request according to STATE_VVL_LIH_SCG
LC_VVL_LIH_SWI_IMDT_SWI_COR [7] V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Immediate VVL switching request according to STATE_VVL_LIH_SWI_COR
LC_VVL_SWI_COR_ACT V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Activation of switching correction after unclear VVL position
� General Information
If there is a failure in the switch VVL system a special reaction is needed.
In case of an SCG failure the switching with the opposite actuator at that cylinder has to be inhibited. Otherwise
this would lead to engine damage.
If there is an SCP_OC or a mechanical failure then limp home state valve lifting curves are set at cylinders with
correct operating actuators.
If not a secure information about the VVL position of all cylinders is availabe, then a switching to ?nd a clear
position is requested (normally successive switching in both directions)
If there is only individual unsuccessful switching then recovery is tried.
In parallel there can be a increase of idle speed or limitation of engine speed requested.
All this de?nitions can be calibrated based on the states STATE_VVL_LIH_DFCT,
STATE_VVL_LIH_SCG and STATE_VVL_LIH_SWI_COR.
Several ?ags are showing the status of the limp home management:
- LV_VVL_LIH_SCP: debounced electrical failure "Short Circuit to Plus
- LV_VVL_LIH_OC: debounced electrical failure "Open Circuit"
- LV_VVL_LIH_SCG: debounced electrical failure "Short Circuit to Ground"
- LV_VVL_LIH_SWI_NOT: debounced switching failure
- LV_VVL_LIH_DFCT: Error symptom or debounced failure with information "Valve Lift cannot be switched into
requested direction due to switching failure, SCP

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift limp home manager
- LV_VVL_ SWI_COR_ACT: Switch correction is active
- LV_VVL_LIH: any above mentioned action is ongoing
In case of an required activity, following variables from Limp Home Management are de?ned:
- LV_N_IS_MIN_REQ_VVL_LIH: Flag to request an increase of idle speed from aggregate ENSL
- LV_N_LIM_MAX_REQ_VVL_LIH: Flag to request an engine speed limitation from aggregate ENSL
- LV_VVL_LIH_SWI_ACT: Request to switch the valve lift in a limp home position
- VLFT_SP_VVL_LIH: Setpoint for limp home switching
- LV_VVL_LIH_SWI_IMDT: Set if a immediately switch request is required, without adaptation of torque

� General Information
LV_VVL_LIH_ERR_SUM is used to set STATE_VVL_CTL directly in "limp home" (LIH) in order to inhibit switching
corrections in the same DC if a VLFT error is detected. (no switching corrections in case of start stop).
LV_VVL_LIH_ERR_SUM will be set if any actuator has one of the following errors.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at reset and IGKON:
LV_VVL_LIH_ERR_SUM = 0
LV_VVL_LIH_ERR_SUM_LST_ES = 0
at ERU2ES and during deactivation:
if STATE_VVL_CTL = "LIH"
and LV_VVL_LIH_ERR_SUM = 1
then LV_VVL_LIH_ERR_SUM_LST_ES = 1
else LV_VVL_LIH_ERR_SUM_LST_ES = 0
end if
Activation: LC_VVL_LIH_INH = 0
Deactivation: not active
Recurrence: Segment

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift actuator test for EOL
Description:
The test is enabled only in certain engine operating range (load, speed, oil and coolant temperature, battery
voltage).
If the test is released by a test device (LV_VLFT_EOL_RLS = 1) the engine has to keep the operation with the
LC_VLFT_SP_ST_EOL valve lifting curve for C_T_DLY_VLFT_EOL_BEG. Then the test is activated.
The test consists of switchings between the valve lifting curves with switching time getting shorter and shorter.
If a limit time is reached without any errors the actuators are working properly. The test is ?nished. If the
diagnosis recognises an unsuccessful switching the test is ?nished too and the error ?ag of the faulty actuator
is set.
There is a waiting time IP_T_WAIT_VLFT_STND(_1)_EOL after each individual switching in order to recognise
self-switching valve lifting curves.
In order to reach this coordination there are interactions of the VVL state coordination function, switching
timing, actuator hit position and diagnosis during this EOL test.
If the test is ?nished once a new start is possible after failure memory reset only.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At deactivation, at failure memory reset:
LV_VVL_EOL_SWI_ACT = 0
T_DLY_VLFT_EOL_BEG = 0
LV_DLY_VLFT_EOL_BEG = 0
T_WAIT_VLFT_EOL = 0
At failure memory reset, at system event ignition on:
LV_VLFT_EOL_END = 0
STATE_EOL_VVL = 5 /* not started */
Activation: LV_VLFT_EOL_RLS = 1
or LC_VLFT_EOL_RLS_TEST_DVC_SUB = 1
Deactivation: Not activation
Recurrence: 100 ms

Subfunction: Switch VVL Timing
For conventional control of the VVL actuator:
Be aware, that if the EOL test is active special switching times are used (please refer to Switch VVL (Switch VVL
actuator test for EOL).
C_FAC_TCO_TOIL_T_SWI_VVL_ACR With this constant the  proportion between TCO and 
TOIL for a modelled temperature at the VVL 
actuator can be defined. 
= 0 only influence of TOIL is considered 
= 1 only influence of TCO is considered 
(start value = 0) 
IP_T_SWI_VVL_ACR( 
LDPM_N_32_2_1_VVLI, 
LDPM_TEMP_REF_1_VVLI) 
Map to define the switching time of the VVL actuator 
based on engine speed and temperature of the 
actuator. This values have been supplied by the 
supplier of the VVL actuator. 
The maximum of switching time is limited by the 
time where the actuator can only reach his hit 
position at a certain cycle! 
(start value = 20 ms) 
IP_FAC_T_SWI_VVL_ACR( 
LDP_VB_MMV_IP_FAC_T_SWI_VVL) 
Factor to consider the influence of the battery 
voltage to the VVL switching time. 
< 1... longer VVL switching time 
= 1... no additional influence 
> 1... longer VVL switching time 
(start value = 1) 
 
For long control of the VVL actuator:
In case that the VVL actuator does not switch, the switching process will be repeated cylinder individual.
For this case the maximum possible control time of the VVL actuator will be used.
IP_T_DLY_SWI_VVL_ACR( 
LDPM_VB_MMV_1_VVLI, 
LDPM_TEMP_REF_1_VVLI) 
  
Calibrate this dead time with the time where the VVL 
actuator  is not yet moving, based on battery voltage 
and temperature of the actuator.  
This values have been supplied by the supplier of the 
VVL actuator. 
(start value = 4 ms) 
C_CRK_DELTA_VVL_SWI_MAX Calibrate this with the max imum allowed number of 
�CRK where the moving of the VVL actuator  is 
allowed 
(start value = 300)

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift control (gen)
Subfunction: Switch VVL Actuator Hit Position
The Actuator Hit Position (CRK_VVL_ACR[NC_CYL_NR]) describes the position where the bolt has to be com-
pletely moved, so the VVL system can switch to the new valve lift. The variable is relating to the ?rst falling
edge of the crankshaft wheel.
C_CRK_VVL_ACR 
[NC_CYL_NR] 
At this CRK position it has to be guaranteed that the VVL 
actuator pin has reached the position needed for VVL 
switching.  ("0�CRK" is at the first falling edge) 
The tolerance of the VVL system have to be considered 
here. 
Hint: The position is at the end of the area where switching is 
possible! 
(this information is needed from the customer) 
C_CRK_VVL_ACR_EOL 
[NC_CYL_NR] 
This calibration constants are similar to 
C_CRK_VVL_ACR[NC_CYL_NR]; the only intended use is 
during end of line test. 
(start value = C_CRK_VVL_ACR[NC_CYL_NR]) 
IP_CRK_N_SHIFT_VVL_ACR( 
LDPM_N_32_3_VVLI, 
LDPM_TEMP_REF_2_VVLI) 
With this map influences to the hit position of the VVL 
actuator (depending on engine speed and actuator 
temperature) can be considered here.  
(start value = 0) 
IP_CRK_VVL_ACR_OFS( 
LDPM_N_32_3_VVLI, 
LDPM_TEMP_REF_2_VVLI) 
Offset of current feed beyond the actuator hit position 
depending on engine speed and actuator temperature. The 
maximum value should be limited by the geometry of the 
VVL system. 
(start value = 0) 
IP_CRK_VVL_ACR_OFS_ADD( 
LDPM_N_32_3_VVLI, 
LDPM_TEMP_REF_2_VVLI) 
Calibration like IP_CRK_VVL_ACR_OFS. Possibility to get 
specific data in case of cylinder individual control of VVL 
actuators. 
(start value = 0) 
 
Subfunction: Switch VVL Control Request Coordination
There new requests will be coordinated.

VVLI, Switch variable valve lift control (gen)
C_NR_SEG_CTR_VVL_ACT Calibration with minimum numbe r of segments where VVL 
controlling can be activated. 
It has to be ensured that the cam has done one complete 
rotation and in addition the starting behaviour of the engine. 
(start value = 8) 
C_CTR_VVL_LIH_CTL_DEAC If this maximum number of sw itching within Limp Home is 
reached, further control is stopped. 
Make measurements with limit samples of the VVL actuator 
to see how often the additional control is useful. Consider in 
addition the maximum of allowed current feed of the 
electronic within a certain time. 
(start value = 3) 
C_CTR_VVL_LIH_CTL_ACT Number of long controls of th e VVL actuator after a non-
switching resp. wrong diagnosis. By reaching this value 
STATE_VVL_CTL will be switching to "LIH".  
Make measurements with limit samples of the VVL actuator 
to see how often the long control is useful. Consider in 
addition the maximum allowed current feed of the electronic 
within a certain time. 
(start value = 3) 
C_CTR_VVL_SWI_NOT_ERR_MAX 
 It inhibits VVL control if the VVL system is in limp home due 
to non-switching at engine stop in the calibratible number 
(CTR_VVL_SWI_NOT_ERR_MAX) in series. 
Proposed value for series production: "= 0" because failure 
in VVL system will be already shown about the malfunction 
indication lamp, a inhibition of the VVL control ist not 
needed. 
(start value = 255) 
C_TOIL_THD_VVL_HOT If a non-switching is detected b elow this defined 
temperature, the Limp Home can be left if temperature 
C_TOIL_THD_VVL_LIH_DEAC is exceeded. 
(start value = -10) 
C_TOIL_THD_VVL_LIH_DEAC Temperature above limp home  can be left after non-
switching at cold start.  
Deactivation should be allowed when a temperature level is 
reached where switching of valve lift can be normally done 
(start value = 20) 
LC_CTR_VVL_LIH_SWI_CLR With this variable the life time counter (CTR_VVL_LIH_ACT) 
can be deleted. 
(start value = 0) 
 
Subfunction: Switch VVL Controller
The Controller is the interface to the BSW. All switching parameters needed for a change of the variable valve
lift will be collected here and communicate to the BSW.

or DFCT failure resp. SWI_COR is set according to the 
concerned STATE_VVL_LIH_SCG, 
STATE_VVL_LIH_DFCT, 
STATE_VVL_LIH_SWI_COR. 
The limitation has to be activated if a driving with this 
valve lift can damage the engine. 
For activation of this functionality an interface to 
"Engine Speed Limitation" is needed. 
(start value = 1, e.g. in case of an SCG failure at 
VLFT_1 actuator  - engine speed will be limited 
because system cannot switch to lift 'STND') 
C_VLFT_SP_VVL_LIH_SCG,  
C_VLFT_SP_VVL_LIH_DFCT, 
C_VLFT_SP_VVL_LIH_SWI_COR 
Valve lifting curve setpoint in case of SCG or DFCT 
failure resp. SWI_COR is set according to the 
concerned STATE_VVL_LIH_SCG, 
STATE_VVL_LIH_DFCT, 
STATE_VVL_LIH_SWI_COR. 
Definition of switch direction (0...STND, 1... LFT_1)  
Aim is, that all cylinders (incl. defect one) have the 
same valve lift.  
At the state SWI_COR the decision has to be done 
case related. 
LC_VVL_LIH_SWI_IMDT_SCG,  
LC_VVL_LIH_SWI_IMDT_DFCT, 
LC_VVL_LIH_SWI_IMDT_SWI_COR 
Immediate VVL switching request according to 
STATE_VVL_LIH_SCG, STATE_VVL_LIH_DFCT or 
STATE_VVL_LIH_SWI_COR to prevent that one 
cylinder is running for a longer time at a wrong valve lift 
(start value = 0 - no immediate VVL switching is 
requested) 
LC_VLFT_SP_VVL_LIH_DFCT In case of both DFCT and SC G failure possibility to 
give priorities 
(start value = 0 - limp home activities due to SCG 
failure have higher priority) 
C_TOIL_VVL_SWI_COR_THD Threshold of oil temperature  to define kind of switch 
correction 
(start value = -10 degree) 
LC_VVL_SWI_COR_ACT Activation of switch correction after unclear VVL 
position 
0 ... deactivation / 1...activation 
(start value = 1)

## Function

This Simulink diagram represents the "Switch VVL Timing" for the regular control of a Variable Valve Lift (VVL) actuator. It seems to be a simplified model that calculates an initial value (`ini`) based on a few parameters. The diagram aims to define timing parameters, particularly delay and moving time.

## Inputs

*   `<T_DLY_SWI_VVL_ACR>`: Delay Time (likely in seconds or milliseconds) before the VVL actuator starts moving. Initialized to 0.
*   `<T_MOVE_SWI_VVL_ACR_MAX>`: Maximum Moving Time (likely in seconds or milliseconds) for the VVL actuator. Initialized to 0.
*   `<T_SWI_VVL_ACR>`: Unknown parameter, possibly a general switching time. Initialized to 0.
*   `<T_SWI_VVL_ACR_ADD>`: Unknown parameter, possibly an additional switching time. Initialized to 0.
*   `<TEMP_REF_T_SWI_VVL_ACR>`: Reference Temperature, possibly used for temperature compensation. Initialized to -48.

## Outputs

*   `ini`: A single output signal that appears to be an initial value derived from the input parameters. The exact calculation is not visible. This likely connects to a larger control system. The signal may determine the initial state of VVL based on timing requirements.

## Logic Flow

1.  The diagram receives several inputs: delay time, maximum moving time, unknown switching parameters, and a reference temperature. These are numerical values defined by the modeler and will come from elsewhere in the overall VVL system model, such as calibration parameters.

## Inputs

**Figure 78.5.3 Inputs:**

**Figure 78.5.4 Outputs:**

*   `<LV_INH_PREP_VLFT_1>`:  Output from the ramp block, inhibiting the transition from state `VLFT_STND` to state `PREP_VLFT_1`.
*    `<LV_CLU_SWI>`: y

## Logic Flow

**Figure 78.5.3 Logic Flow:**

1.  The current VVL state (`<STATE_VLFT_MNG>`) is compared against several possible state values: `TRAN_VLFT_1`, `TRAN_VLFT_STND`, `PREP_VLFT_STND`, and `PREP_VLFT_1`.
2.  Each comparison uses an equality block (`==`).
3.  The output of each equality block is then fed into a "NOT" gate.
4.  The output of the "NOT" gate is fed into the "Enable" (E) port of a triggered subsystem, along with an x_in signal on the R port.
5.  The triggered subsystem consists of a clock with a sample time (`dT`) of 1. When enabled, the output `x_out` will increase by 1 every sample time. This effectively implements a timer.
6.  The `x_out` of each triggered subsystem produces a signal to start a transition to another state

**Figure 78.5.4 Logic Flow:**

1.  The clutch switch signal (`<LV_CLU_SWI>`) passes through a Unit Delay block (1/z) with an initial value of 0. This effectively delays the clutch switch signal by one time step. This delay represents storing the previous state of the clutch switch.
2.  An interpolation block (IP_T_CLU_SWI_VVL) receives engine speed (`<N>`) and engine torque (`<TCO>`) as inputs (x_val and y_val) and outputs a signal `P_val` that varies depending on the current speed and torque.
3. The delayed clutch signal is then multiplied by `P_val`.
4.  The output of the multiplication is then feed into a ramp block. The input "IV" is set to the product of the clutch and PID signals. The input "R" is set to 100.
5.  The ramp block effectively integrates the multiplication, limiting it by "R" and outputting `<LV_INH_PREP_VLFT_1>`.  This output inhibits the transition from the `VLFT_STND` state to the `PREP_VLFT_1` state, providing a delay based on the value of the clutch signal and dependent on the current operating condition of the engine.

In summary, Figure 78.5.3 handles the triggering of state transitions based on the current state, and Figure 78.5.4 introduces a condition to inhibit a specific transition (from `VLFT_STND` to `PREP_VLFT_1`) based on the clutch switch position, engine speed, and engine torque.

It handles the transition between these states based on engine operating conditions such as requested torque and manifold pressure.

## Inputs
The primary input to this state machine is `TRAN_VVL_CTL`.  This is a control signal that dictates the transitions between different valve lift states.  Also, `STATE_ACK_VVL` likely represents a state acknowledgement signal. ## Inputs
The primary input to this state machine is `TRAN_VVL_CTL`.  This is a control signal that dictates the transitions between different valve lift states.  Also, `STATE_ACK_VVL` likely represents a state acknowledgement signal. The 'en:' fields within each state also suggest that `STATE_VLFT_MNG` acts as another primary input, or an internal state used in combination with `TRAN_VVL_CTL` to determine transitions. Implicit inputs also include the current engine operating conditions which dictate the requested torque, and manifold pressure, which are used to set the `TRAN_VVL_CTL` signal.

## Outputs
The primary outputs are:
*   `STATE_VLFT_MNG`: The active VVL state. This is internal to the state machine but essential for other engine control functions.
*   `EVE_CLC_...`: Events triggered when entering or exiting a given state, enabling further actions such as enabling or disabling specific valve lift. For example, `EVE_CLC_PREP_VLFT_STND` is triggered when entering the `PREP_VLFT_STND` state.
*   `LV_VVL_TRAN_ACT`: A binary control signal set based on the active state for the VVL system.

## Logic Flow
1.  **Initialization:** The state machine starts in the `INIT` state. It transitions from the `INIT` state when `STATE_ACK_VVL_0 == 0`.

2.  **State Transitions:** The system cycles among the following states (VLFT_STND, PREP_VLFT_STND, TRAN_VLFT_STND, VLFT_1, PREP_VLFT_1, and TRAN_VLFT_1), and transitions are governed by the value of the input signal `TRAN_VVL_CTL`:
    *   **VLFT_STND:** This represents the standard valve lift state.  Transitions to `PREP_VLFT_1` occur when `TRAN_VVL_CTL == 1`.
    *   **PREP_VLFT_1:** This state prepares the system for VLFT_1 mode. Transition to `VLFT_1` happens when `TRAN_VVL_CTL == 2`.
    *   **VLFT_1:** The engine is in the VLFT_1 mode. Transitions to `TRAN_VLFT_1` when `TRAN_VVL_CTL == 3`.
    *   **TRAN_VLFT_1:** This state facilitates transition from VLFT_1. Transitions to `PREP_VLFT_STND` occur when `TRAN_VVL_CTL == 4`.
    *   **PREP_VLFT_STND:** This state prepares the system for the standard valve lift state. Transitions to `TRAN_VLFT_STND` occur when `TRAN_VVL_CTL == 5`.
    *   **TRAN_VLFT_STND:** This state facilitates the transition to the standard valve lift mode. Transitions to `VLFT_STND` when `TRAN_VVL_CTL == 6`.
    * Reverse transitions from VLFT_1 to PREP_VLFT_STND when TRAN_VVL_CTL is 8.
    * Reverse transitions from VLFT_STND to PREP_VLFT_1 when TRAN_VVL_CTL is 10.

3.  **State Actions:** On entry (`en:`) into each state, `STATE_VLFT_MNG` is updated with a state-specific value. An event (`EVE_CLC_...`) specific to that state is triggered. During (`du:`) each state, STATE_VLFT_MNG is updated again, and an event may be triggered as well.  Finally, the `LV_VVL_TRAN_ACT` signal is set to a state-specific value (either 0 or 1).

In essence, this state machine is a complex set of logic to manage the transitions and preparation between two different valve lift profiles based on engine commands represented by the  `TRAN_VVL_CTL` signal.

## Logic Flow

1.  **NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ:** This input represents the standard cylinder request for the variable valve lift system.

3.  **Inhibit Logic:** The "NOT" block inverts the **LV_INH_VLFT_STND** signal. This inverted signal is combined with **LV_INH_VLFT_1** and **LV_TQI_VLFT_STND_REQ** through an "OR" gate. ## Logic Flow

**MAF Calculation (Figure 78.512):**

1.  `MAF_CBK_1_1` and `MAF_CBK_2_1` are summed.
2.  The sum is multiplied by 0.5 (equivalent to averaging).
3.  Result is `MAF_VLFT_1_2`.
4.  Steps 1-3 are repeated with  `MAF_SP_TQI_CBK_SEL_1_1` and `MAF_SP_TQI_CBK_SEL_2_1` resulting in `MAF_SP_TQI_IT_2`.

**TRAN_VLFT_1 Transition Condition (Figure 78.513):**

1.  **MAP/MAF comparison**:  The inputs `<MAP>` and `<MAP_SP>` are subtracted. The difference (V.7.7) is then compared using a lookup table with inputs `<MAF_VLFT_1>` (x_val) and y_val (fixed value). The output p_val (V.7.14) is then compared with a threshold value (V.6.9, `IP_MAP VLFT_1_DIF_THD`).

2.

The difference (V.7.7) is then compared using a lookup table with inputs `<MAF_VLFT_1>` (x_val) and y_val (fixed value). The output p_val (V.7.14) is then compared with a threshold value (V.6.9, `IP_MAP VLFT_1_DIF_THD`).

2.  **Timer comparison**: The timer `<T_STATE_VVL_MNG_TRAN_VLFT_1>` is compared to the calibration timer `C_T_STATE_VVL_MNG_TRAN_VLFT_1`.

3.  **Condition 1 AND Condition 2 Logic:**  The results from steps 1 and 2 are combined using an OR operator (V.6.7). Additionally, the cylinder request signal `<NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ>` is compared against 0 (V.6.6) using an equality operator, and the results are combined using an AND operator (V.6.10). This output is one of the final logic gates.

4.  **STND Inhibition Logic:** The signal `<NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_ACT>` is compared against `<NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ>` using a "Not Equal" operator, and the result is combined with conditions where the standard lift transition should be disabled `<LV_INH_VLFT_STND>`, `<LV_INH_VLFT_1>`, `<LV_TQI_VLFT_STND_REQ>`. This entire logic combination uses an OR (V.6.7) and AND (V.6.10) logic and is the second input to the final logic gate. The value is passed through a NOT block.

5.  **Transition Control**: The outputs of steps 3 and 4 feed into AND (V.6.10) and OR (V.6.7) logic combinations. The output of the final logic gates determines if a transition should occur.  Two transition paths are available:  `VLFT_1` and `NO_TRANSITION`.  A saturation block ensures the control signals do not exceed a maximum value. The block titled `<LV_TRAN_VLFT_1>` dictates if the engine will attempt to transition to the VLFT_1 state.

## Function

This Simulink diagram implements the logic for switching the variable valve lift (VVL) state, specifically coordinating the transition to the "STND" (Standard) valve lift setting. It checks a variety of conditions related to driver demand, system state, and torque thresholds before allowing the transition. The aim is to ensure the engine operates efficiently and smoothly.

## Inputs

*   `NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ`: Cylinder request for Standard valve lift
*   `LV_TRAN_VLFT_1`: Previous valve lift transition request
*   `LV_VLFT_STND_INH_EXT`: External inhibit for Standard valve lift
*   `LV_TQI_VLFT_STND_REQ`: Torque based request for Standard valve lift
*   `C_STATE_VLFT_STND_REQ_EXT_ENA`: External enable for Standard valve lift request
*   `LV_VLFT_STND_REQ_SWI_EXT`: Request from switch for Standard valve lift
*   `LV_INH_VLFT_1`: Inhibit valve lift
*   `LV_N_GRD_VLFT_STND_REQ`: Standard valve lift request not on a gradient
*   `LV_VVL_SWI_AUTH`: Variable Valve Lift switch authorized
*   `LV_ST_END`: End of state signal
*   `LV_IGK`: Ignition key signal
*   `LV_INH_VLFT_STND`: Inhibit Standard valve lift
*   `LV_STST_STOP_CYC`: Stop cycle
*   `LV_VVL_LIH_SWI_ACT`: Switch activation of low indicated height
*   `TCO`: Torque Current Output
*   `TCO_MIN_VLFT_STND_INH_FIRST`: Minimum torque threshold for Standard valve lift inhibit
*   `TOIL`: Torque Output Indicated Low
*   `C_TOIL_MIN_VLFT_STND_INH_FIRST`: Low Minimum torque threshold for Standard valve lift inhibit
*   `CTR_VLFT_1_ACT`: Actual valve lift position
*   `LV_TRAN_VLFT_1`: previous valve lift position

## Outputs

*   `TRAN_VVL_CTL`: Transition VVL Control
*   `CTR_VLFT_1_ACT`: Actual valve lift position
*   `LV_INH_VLFT_STND_FIRST_SWI`: Switch input signal

## Logic Flow

1.

**External Request and Inhibit Logic:**
    *   It starts by checking external requests for Standard valve lift (`NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ` and `LV_TRAN_VLFT_1` are 0).
    *   It also checks if external inhibits are active (`LV_VLFT_STND_INH_EXT` is false) AND if there is a torque based request (`LV_TQI_VLFT_STND_REQ` is true).
    *   A state machine (`C_STATE_VLFT_STND_REQ_EXT_ENA`) and a switch signal (`LV_VLFT_STND_REQ_SWI_EXT`), combined with the inhibit `LV_INH_VLFT_1` and gradient `LV_N_GRD_VLFT_STND_REQ` determine if Standard valve lift can be requested.
    *   These condition are combined with an `OR` gate.
2.  **Internal Request Validation:**
    *   The diagram then checks the VVL switch authority (`LV_VVL_SWI_AUTH`), state (`LV_ST_END`), ignition key (`LV_IGK`), inhibition (`LV_INH_VLFT_STND`) and stop conditions (`LV_STST_STOP_CYC`).
3.  **Torque Threshold Checks:**
    *   It compares the current torque (`TCO`, `TOIL`) with minimum torque thresholds (`TCO_MIN_VLFT_STND_INH_FIRST`, `C_TOIL_MIN_VLFT_STND_INH_FIRST`). If the current torque is below the minimum threshold, and several inhibits are in place, the transition to standard lift is inhibited.
4.  **Valve Lift Position Check**
    * It compares the current valve lift `CTR_VLFT_1_ACT` plus 1 and compares against the previous valve lift `LV_TRAN_VLFT_1`.
5.  **Transition Control:**
    *   The results of the external, internal, and torque checks, plus other inhibits are combined. If all checks pass, `PREP_VLFT_STND` will get selected. Otherwise, the `NO_TRANSITION` will be selected
    *   The final output `TRAN_VVL_CTL` is a result of switching between the two. The decision is based on the condition that `Check ~= 0`.

## Logic Flow

Here's a step-by-step breakdown of the logical flow within the diagram:

1.  **Valve Lift Request and Inhibits:** The signals related to the valve lift request and the inhibits go into an `AND` Block to determine a preliminary transition control signal. `NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ` is the main request signal for switching to a specific valve lift state.  However, `LV_INH_VLFT_1`, `LV_INH_VLFT_STND`, and `LV_TQI_VLFT_STND_REQ` are inhibit signals. The `NOT` block inverts inhibit signals to appropriately block a transition. The IGA signals related to MAF are summed and compared against a threshold. Signals `LV_VVL_LIH_SWI_IMDT` and `LV_N_MAX_VLFT_STND_REQ` are fed into an OR block. All these signals combine in another OR gate, and are fed into the same `AND` block.

The `TQI_BAS_CBK_SEL_L`, `TQI_BAS_CBK_SEL_H`, and `LV_PORT_DEAC` signals are combined in an algebraic block and the result is compared to `TQI_AV`.  The `CLC_TQI_BAS_CBK_SEL_bank_dependant` block seems to provide additional offset based on the engine bank.
4.  **MAF Offset**: The mass air flow setpoint `MAF_SP` is inputted to a 1-D lookup table that generates `IP_TQ_TRAN_VLFT_STND_OFS`.
5.  **Transition Check and Output:** The intermediate transition signal `LC_TQ_TRAN_VVL_CHK` along with a zero value are fed into a Compare to Zero block, which seems to act as a gate.

In summary, this diagram represents a complex control system for switching variable valve lift states. It considers numerous engine operating conditions, requests, and inhibits to determine the appropriate control signal. The system incorporates a torque intervention check and engine state transitions to ensure a safe and smooth transition between valve lift states.

## Logic Flow

1.  **External Request and Manual Request:**
    *   `LV_VLFT_STND_REQ_SWI_EXT` and `STATE_VLFT_STND_REQ_EXT_ENA` are compared with a value of '2'. This result is ANDed with `C_NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ_MAN` and `LC_NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ_MAN`. The output decides if the external request is valid.
2.  **Temperature Condition:**
    *   `TAM` is compared with `C_TAM_THD_MIN_IGK_INH_VLFT_STND`. If `TAM` is greater than `C_TAM_THD_MIN_IGK_INH_VLFT_STND`, it passes.

    *   `LV_IGK` (Ignition Key) is negated (NOT).

4.  **Oil Temperature Condition:**
    *   `TOIL` is compared with `C_TOIL_MAX_IGK_INH_VLFT_STND`. If `TOIL` is greater than `C_TOIL_MAX_IGK_INH_VLFT_STND`, it passes.
5.  **Combined Conditions and Cylinder Management:**
    *   The results of temperature condition, speed condition, and oil temperature conditions are checked.
    *   `<NC_CYL_NR>` is compared to 0.

6.  **Final Request and State Transition:**

This state represents the desired transition of the variable valve lift system.

The logic flows are described separately for the two parts:

*   The state transitions are determined by the conditions specified within the brackets `[]`. These conditions involve the `STATE_VLFT_MNG` and  `NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ_MNG` input signals.
*   **NO\_TRAN:** This is the initial state. Transitions *from* this state depend on `STATE_VLFT_MNG`.

1.  **Engine Speed Check:** The input `C_N_MAX_VVL_CLC` (engine speed) is compared to `<N>`.  If `C_N_MAX_VVL_CLC` is less than `<N>`, `cond_if` block outputs 1, otherwise it outputs 0.

3.  **AND Gate:** The outputs of the engine speed check and the cylinder request check are fed into an AND gate.  The AND gate produces a 1 only if both inputs are 1, and 0 otherwise.
4.  **VLFT\_1 Enable Logic:** If the AND gate's output is 1, the `cond_if`block outputs 1, else it outputs 0.
5.  **Merge:** A 0 (V.6.11) is subtracted from the VLFT_1 Enable Logic output, but this means that the final merge simply passes the Enable Logic's output straight through. The signal `<LV_VVL_CLC_ENA>` is thus generated. This signal enables the VLFT\_1 mode.

## Function

The primary function of this Simulink diagram is to determine and output a condition signal to inhibit a variable valve lift (VVL) state change during a start/stop cycle. This module, part of a VVL state coordination system, aims to prevent undesirable valve lift changes while the engine is preparing to stop or restarting.

## Inputs

*   `<LV_ST>` (V.6.11): Current Valve Lift State.  Likely a signal representing the current operational state of the variable valve lift system.
*   `C_PV_AV_VLFT_FIRST_SWI` (V.6.11):  A calibration parameter representing a threshold value or condition related to the preferred valve lift state. It relates to "PV AV" which might stand for "Preferred Valve AV"
*   `<PV_AV>` (V.6.9) A signal representing the Preferred Valve AV.
*   `C_VLFT_INH_CYC_CAST` (V.6.11):  Another calibration parameter related to inhibiting the valve lift change during a cyclic event (potentially start/stop cycle). It relates to "CYC CAST" which might stand for "Cyclic Cast".
*   `<CYC_CAST>` (V.6.9) A signal representing the Cyclic Cast.

## Outputs

*   `<LV_INH_VLFT_ST_CDN>` (V.6.10): Valve Lift State Change Inhibition Condition. This is a boolean signal. A value of 1 (after the `Check ~= 0` block in the diagram) likely indicates that a valve lift state change should be inhibited. A value of 0 suggests that a state change is permissible.

## Logic Flow

1.  **Valve Lift State Input:** The current valve lift state `<LV_ST>` enters the system and appears to be fed through a Constant block outputting a constant value of 1. This value goes straight to the output block depending on the `Check ~= 0` value.
2.  **Threshold Comparisons:**
    *   The signal `<PV_AV>`  is compared to the calibration parameter `C_PV_AV_VLFT_FIRST_SWI` using a "less than or equal to" (`<=`) block. This comparison block outputs a boolean (1 or 0) signal.
    *   Similarly, the signal `<CYC_CAST>` is compared to `C_VLFT_INH_CYC_CAST` using a "less than or equal to" (`<=`) block, generating another boolean signal.
3.  **AND Logic:** The two boolean signals from the comparison blocks are fed into an AND logic gate.  The AND gate outputs a 1 (TRUE) only if both of its inputs are 1 (TRUE). Otherwise, the AND gate outputs 0 (FALSE).
4.  **Check ~= 0 Block:** This block inverts the output of the AND gate. A non-zero value (i.e. 1 or TRUE) from the AND gate becomes 0 (FALSE) and vice versa.
5.  **Output:**  The final output, `<LV_INH_VLFT_ST_CDN>`, represents the valve lift state change inhibition condition. If the combined conditions of the calibration parameters and valve lift state are met (resulting in a TRUE from the AND gate), the inversion results in FALSE, meaning the inhibition is inactive, else the inhibition will be active.

## Function

The Simulink diagram appears to implement a Variable Valve Lift (VVL) control request coordination and state determination. It combines several error conditions and internal states to generate a VVL control signal and also determines the previous and last states of VVL control.

## Inputs

*   **ENC_CYL_NR:** Engine Cylinder Number
*   **LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCG:** Low Valve Lift Error Standard, SCG condition
*   **LV_ERR_VLFT_1_SCG:** Low Valve Lift Error, SCG condition
*   **LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCP_OC:** Low Valve Lift Error Standard, SCP Open Circuit condition
*   **STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT:** State Variable Valve Lift Switch, NOT condition
*   **STATE_VVL_CTL_cur:** Current State of Variable Valve Lift Control
*   **STATE_VVL_CTL_PREV:** Previous State of Variable Valve Lift Control

## Outputs

*   **LV_VVL_LIH_TEST_CTL_ACT:** Low Valve Lift Test Control Active Signal
*   **STATE_VVL_CTL_LST:**  Last State of Variable Valve Lift Control
*   **STATE_VVL_CTL_PREV:** Previous State of Variable Valve Lift Control

## Logic Flow

The diagram consists of two distinct parts:

**Part 1: VVL Control Request Coordination**

1.  **Error Condition Checks:** `LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCG`, `LV_ERR_VLFT_1_SCG`, and `LV_ERR_VLFT_STND_SCP_OC` signals are each passed through a NOT gate. This likely represents inverting an error signal; i.e., if the error signal is true (1), the output of the NOT gate will be false (0).
2.  **State Switching:** `STATE_VVL_SWI_NOT` is passed through a `GET BIT` block. The value of `bit_sel` is set to 0 which means the function extracts the LSB (least significant bit).
3.  **Combination with VVL states:** The current and previous states are compared using the "==" block.
4.  **AND Logic:** The outputs of the NOT gates from step 1 and outputs from `GET BIT` and "==" block are then combined using an AND gate.  This suggests that the errors must be absent *and* certain VVL switch and state conditions must be met for the VVL system to be enabled or modified.
5.  **Conditional Logic:** The output of the AND gates is fed to a `cond_if` block. `cond_if` directs the value 1 or 0, based on whether the conditions are met.
6. **Merge logic**: The `cond_if` block outputs are then merged.
7.  **Output:** The output of the merge block goes to LV_VVL_LIH_TEST_CTL_ACT.

**Part 2: Determination of Last and Previous State**

1.  **State Comparison:** The current VVL control state (`STATE_VVL_CTL_cur`) is compared to the previous VVL control state (`STATE_VVL_CTL_PREV`) using a "Not Equal" block.
2.  **Triggered Subsystem/Function Call:** The output of the "Not Equal" block triggers `trig_output` that in turns enables function `fcn_call`. This subsystem or function is responsible for updating the `STATE_VVL_CTL_LST` (Last State) and feeding the `STATE_VVL_CTL_cur` value to the `STATE_VVL_CTL_PREV` output (through a unit delay in a feedback loop).

In summary, the diagram implements logic for controlling a Variable Valve Lift system, taking into account error conditions, internal states, and switch positions. It also provides a mechanism for tracking the previous and last states of the VVL controller.

## Function

The primary function of this Simulink diagram is to coordinate the request for switching the variable valve lift (VVL) to the next possible cylinder bank.  It determines whether a switch should be triggered based on several input conditions related to cylinder bank requests, inhibit signals, and current system state. This is described as "Switch next possible Cylinder Bank to Valve Lift Standard."

## Inputs

*   `<LV_VVL_SWI_REQ>`:  Variable Valve Lift Switch Request - likely a boolean indicating a request to switch VVL.

It determines whether a switch should be triggered based on several input conditions related to cylinder bank requests, inhibit signals, and current system state. This is described as "Switch next possible Cylinder Bank to Valve Lift Standard."

## Inputs

*   `<LV_VVL_SWI_REQ>`:  Variable Valve Lift Switch Request - likely a boolean indicating a request to switch VVL.
*   `<NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ>`: Number of valve lift standard cylinder request - Likely the number of cylinders requesting standard lift.
*   `<NC_CYL_NR>`:  Number of Cylinders - likely the total number of cylinders.
*   `<LV_VVL_CTL_RLS>`: Variable Valve Lift Control Release - Indicates if the VVL control is released.
*   `<LF_VLFT_STND_LIH_INH>`: Valve Lift Standard Limit Inhibit - Prevents switching to VVL.

## Outputs

*   `STATE_VVL_SWI_MOD`: State of Variable Valve Lift Switch Mode - Likely indicates the current mode.
*   `LV_VVL_CTL_TRIG`: Variable Valve Lift Control Trigger - A trigger signal to initiate the VVL switch.
*   `LV_VLFT_SWI_DIR`: Valve Lift Switch Direction - Likely indicates the direction or target of the VVL switch.

## Logic Flow

1.  **Inversion of Switch Request:** The `<LV_VVL_SWI_REQ>` is inverted via a NOT gate. This likely represents a condition where the *absence* of a switch request might be relevant.

2.  **Inversion of Inhibit Signal:** The `<LF_VLFT_STND_LIH_INH>` signal is inverted using a NOT gate. This likely means the logic wants to proceed when the *inhibit signal is not active*.

3.  **Compare Cylinders:** The `NR_VLFT_STND_CYL_REQ` and `NC_CYL_NR` signals are compared for equality using an "==" block.  This checks if the number of standard cylinder requests equals the total number of cylinders. This is combined in the AND gate logic.

4.  **AND Gate Logic:** All conditions are fed into an AND gate:  The inverted LV\_VVL\_SWI\_REQ, the inverted LF\_VLFT\_STND\_LIH\_INH and comparison of cylinder count values. If all inputs to the AND gate are true, then the output is true. This means:
    *   A switch request is *not* active (LV\_VVL\_SWI\_REQ is FALSE, making NOT(LV\_VVL\_SWI\_REQ) TRUE)
    *   The valve lift standard limit is *not* inhibited (LF\_VLFT\_STND\_LIH\_INH is FALSE, making NOT(LF\_VLFT\_STND\_LIH\_INH) TRUE)

## Function

The Simulink diagram represents the logic for switching the variable valve lift setpoint (VVLI). It consists of two main sections: the upper part determines the instantaneous request for a particular valve lift, and the lower part introduces a delay to the switching request based on certain conditions.

## Inputs

*   **MAF_SP_TQI:** Mass Air Flow setpoint based on Torque request (and others).
*   **C_N_HYS_VLFT_1_SP:** Engine speed hysteresis value for low to high lift transition.
